EvilBank used RSA keys with moduli from Blum integers. They encrypted their secret code: 4984504934769334100629195106117850627702745255661739613720985046966942134175897693121865230281242213567605749689816579221320452585985375073912191008736327. Can you break their flawed crypto and recover the code?

The flag format is flag{...}
n=6614981311064857463039356380300938339864425229058809976918817431351861317248624568265022589821208264725797831626641529503170362599327560145795034436042377, e=3901697853790115065890539020754751156366240831063614322986110367882407444827415971191452934762747363019385985194374260662624087861257472450215900253517843
The lower 104 bits of p are: 71043798461298277481681096494377192735


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{mq0te3yd}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 4984504934769334100629195106117850627702745255661739613720985046966942134175897693121865230281242213567605749689816579221320452585985375073912191008736327
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=6614981311064857463039356380300938339864425229058809976918817431351861317248624568265022589821208264725797831626641529503170362599327560145795034436042377, e=3901697853790115065890539020754751156366240831063614322986110367882407444827415971191452934762747363019385985194374260662624087861257472450215900253517843
The lower 104 bits of p are: 71043798461298277481681096494377192735

extra_info: p=100367987529366682845037618271383743462868369864501549028047449190343876136223, q=65907282529993731316000950550746228648680261050022072678621249529353808058199, Ï†(n)=6614981311064857463039356380300938339864425229058809976918817431351861317248458292994963229407047226156975701654529980872255838977620891447075336751847956
